Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.fasttrack.messenger

Interface MobileMessenger

public interface MobileMessenger
This class is used to create mobile messenger client by providing all backend server configuration parameters
Since:
5.3.0

  • Method Details

    • register

      void register(@NonNull String userId, @NonNull String userAlias, @NonNull String registrationCode, @Nullable Map<String,String> customHeaders, @NonNull RegistrationCallback callback)
      Performs the registration of the user to the OOB server.

      Note:
      This method returns control to the caller almost immediately (not blocking call). The completion is notified to the caller via the specified callback.

      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user who registers to the OOB server.
      userAlias - Human readable alias for this client.
      registrationCode - Registration is authorised by the registration code entered by the user via the application UI.
      customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
      callback - The callback to be triggered as soon as the operation completes with any result. Must never be null. Note that the callback is always called from within the main UI thread context and always after this method returns to its caller.

    • unregister

      void unregister(@Nullable Map<String,String> customHeaders, @NonNull MobileMessengerCallback messengerCallback)
      Performs the un-registration of the client.

      Note:
      This method returns control to the caller almost immediately (not blocking call). The completion is notified
      Use this API only when there is one and only one clientId.
      to the caller via the specified callback.

      Parameters:
      customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
      messengerCallback - The callback to be triggered as soon as the operation completes with any result. Must never be null. Note that the callback is always called from within the main UI thread context and always after this method returns to its caller.

    • unregister

      void unregister(@NonNull String clientId, @Nullable Map<String,String> customHeaders, @NonNull MobileMessengerCallback messengerCallback)
      Performs the unregistration of the user to the OOB server.

      Note:
      This method returns control to the caller almost immediately (not blocking call). The completion is notified to the caller via the specified callback.
      Use this API only when there is one and only one clientId.

      Parameters:
      clientId - The ID of the user who unregister from the OOB server.
      customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
      messengerCallback - The callback to be triggered as soon as the operation completes with any result. Must never be null. Note that the callback is always called from within the main UI thread context and always after this method returns to its caller.

    • refreshToken

      void refreshToken(@NonNull String channel, @Nullable String endpoint, @Nullable Map<String,String> customHeaders, @NonNull MobileMessengerCallback callback)

      Set/Clear the notification profile. The framework updates the notification profile on the OOB server in the first time. In subsequent invocation to this API, the framework checks the value of the endPoint. Notification profile is updated if the endPoint value is different from previous value. Otherwise the framework skips the server call.

      Note:
      Use this API only when there is one and only one clientId.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread. If a null list is provided, the notification profile will be cleared.

      Parameters:
      channel - The channel to use for the notification (SMS, push, email, etc.)
      endpoint - Value associated with this channel.
      customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • refreshToken

      void refreshToken(@NonNull String clientId, @NonNull String channel, @Nullable String endpoint, @Nullable Map<String,String> customHeaders, @NonNull MobileMessengerCallback messengerCallback)

      Set/Clear the notification profile. The framework updates the notification profile on the OOB server on the first time. In subsequent invocation to this API, the framework checks the value of the endPoint. Notification profile is updated if the endPoint value is different from previous value. Otherwise the framework skips the server call.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread. If a null list is provided, the notification profile will be cleared.

      Parameters:
      clientId - The ID of the user who registered with the OOBS.
      channel - The channel to use for the notification (SMS, push, email, etc.)
      endpoint - Value associated with this channel.
      customHeaders - The request parameter containing custom header.
      messengerCallback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • listClients

      Set<String> listClients(@NonNull String userId)
      Return all the clients that has been registered for the userId.
      Returns:
      set of client IDs

    • listClients

      Set<String> listClients()
      Return all the clients that has been registered.
      Returns:
      set of client IDs

    • defaultMessageManager

      @Nullable MobileMessageManager defaultMessageManager(@NonNull String providerId) throws FastTrackException
      Returns the Default Mobile Message Manager.
      Note:
      Use this API only when there is one and only one clientId.
      Otherwise FastTrackException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      providerId - The ID of the provider used for message communication.
      Returns:
      the default MobileMessageManager object.
      Throws:
      FastTrackException

    • getMessageManager

      @Nullable MobileMessageManager getMessageManager(@NonNull String clientId, @NonNull String providerId)
      Returns the Mobile Message Manager
      Parameters:
      clientId - The ID of the user who registered with the OOBS.
      providerId - The ID of the provider used for message communication.
      Returns:
      the MobileMessageManager object attached to the provided clientId.

    • persistClientId

      boolean persistClientId(@NonNull String userId, @NonNull String clientId)
      If your client was registered using Core API of the Mobile Protector SDK, call this method to insert your clientId so you can use your existing data with the new APIs.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID associated with the clientId
      clientId - The ID of the user who registered with the OOBS.
      Returns:
      boolean if the clientId and userId has been successfully stored.
